DOC.criteria: 1 . Male Female , 18 45years age ( inclusive ) 65 year age old . 2 . Nonobese define within 15 % desirable body weight frame size ( Appendix II ) . 3 . Any significant immunological , pulmonary , hematologic , endocrine and/or metabolic disease disorder severe acute medical illness , , metastatic cancer , brain tumor , decompensated cardiac , hepatic renal failure . 8 . Neurological disorder include delirium , history head trauma , movement disorder , dementia , multiple sclerosis , stroke , within past 6 month precede study . 2 . Any central nervous system disorder include Alzheimer 's disease , Parkinson 's disease , epilepsy , cerebrovascular disease . 3 . Any psychiatric disorder ( except personality disorder ) . 4 . Any mood disorder include MDD current relapse past three year . 5 . ADHD . 6 . Any condition may cause depression include endocrinopathies diabetes , lymphoma , pancreatic cancer . 7 . Any illness disorder opinion Investigator would place subject significant risk inability follow requirement study regard maintain schedule visit patch application . 8 . Use medication list within five halflives prior baseline . A long period time may specifically note certain medication indicate : 1 . All contraindicated medication ( see Section 7.1.4.3 ) 2 . Psychotropic medication , include centrally active anticholinergic , anticonvulsant , antiparkinsonian agent , fluoxetine ( 5 week ) , MAOIs ( 2 week ) , antipsychotic ( oral 60 day ; intramuscular 10 week ) , anxiolytic , vasodilator ( exception : Viagra permit ) , cerebral enhancer ( acetylcholinesterase inhibitor ) , psychostimulants , lithium carbonate , nootropics , reserpine , methyldopa ( within 30 day ) , ergot preparation . 3 . Sympathomimetic drug , e.g. , amphetamine , methylphenidate , dopamine , epinephrine , norepinephrine , overthecounter ( OTC ) prescription nasal decongestant ( exception nasal steroid ) , oral inhale sympathomimetic bronchodilator ( e.g. , albuterol [ Proventil ] , Serevent ) appetite suppressant . 4 . Any serotonergic drug include sumatriptan succinate ( Imitrex ) , zolmitriptan ( Zomig ) , cyproheptadine ( Periactin ) , methysergide ( Sansert ) agonists antagonist serotonin receptor . 5 .
